bibl.title: Intertextuality in Callimachus' Aetia.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Criteria for allusions. - 3. Intertextuality and the presentation of the stories in the Aetia. - 4. Intertextuality as a mean to highlight meta-poetic and programmatic issues. - 5. Conclusion.

bibl.title: Franco MONTANARI et Luigi LEHNUS (Entretiens préparés et présidés par), Callimaque = Entretiens sur l'Antiquité classique. XLVIII

bibl.seg: HARDER Annette, Intertextuality in Callimachus' Aetia.
Franco MONTANARI et Luigi LEHNUS (Entretiens préparés et présidés par), Callimaque = Entretiens sur l'Antiquité classique. XLVIII (Vandoeuvres - Genève, 2002) pp. 189-223; - 224-233.

1. Introduction. - 2. Criteria for allusions. - 3. Intertextuality and the presentation of the stories in the Aetia. - 4. Intertextuality as a mean to highlight meta-poetic and programmatic issues. - 5. Conclusion.
